page.title: 05BUTT AND OYSTER AT PIN MILL
page.content: The Butt and Oyster Pub is by the water's edge at Pin Mill. At some Spring tides the water comes right up to the Pub walls. It is very popular because it is very old and traditional. The building is one of the oldest in Pin Mill. It has brick floors and wooden tables and settles. In the winter there is a log fire in the bar. The beer is served from the barrel. There is a dining room and food is also served out-side in the summer. Many of the customers that go to the Butt and Oyster come from other towns and villages. Locals and yachtsmen also enjoy its warm and friendly atmosphere. Every Christmas Eve there is Carol Singing at the Butt which is lead by the Rector. In the Summer, Morris Dancers and the Land- lord's Mummers team perform.
